metadata.title: CVE-2016-7073 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue has been found in PowerDNS before 3.4.11 and 4.0.2, and PowerDNS recursor before 4.0.4, allowing an attacker in position of man-in-the-middle to alter the content of an AXFR because of insufficient validation of TSIG signatures. A missing check of the TSIG time and fudge values was found in AXFRRetriever, leading to a possible replay attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-7073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.2-1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.0.2-1
pdns-server - 4.0.2-1
pdns-tools - 4.0.2-1
No subscription required

pdns-recursor - 4.0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-1').
pdns-recursor package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.4-1').
